channel.title: Writing on Baki Cakici
channel.description: Recent content in Writing on Baki Cakici

item.title: Spaceships and Poetry: Enlivening the Lab as a Site of Feminist Critical Pedagogy
item.description: We analyse the critical potential of STS lab work in technical environments and provide recommendations from our evolving space of feminist praxis.

item.title: The Politics of Seamlessness: A Rights Claims Perspective on Digital Identification Technologies
item.description: We analyse seamlessness and political participation as digital identification becomes the invisible background of state-citizen interactions.

item.title: When Numbers Run Out: Civil Registration and the Performativity of Methods
item.description: Personal identification numbers used in the Nordic countries contain a fundamental tension that is impossible to resolve via technical fixes.

item.title: Risken är att att 500 miljoner kronor kastas bort på en ny folkräkning
item.description: Mot bakgrund av kunskapsläget är vi förvånade över att regeringen och Sverigedemokraterna avser att driva igenom att Sverige ska genomföra en folkräkning.

item.title: Writing Bodies and Bodies of Text: Thinking Vulnerability Through Monsters
item.description: We suggest approaching writing as a vulnerable practice marked by an unstable boundary between bodies: bodies of text and bodies of writers.

item.title: Data Practices: Making Up a European People
item.description: The book develops a conception of data practices to analyze findings from collaborative ethnographic multisite fieldwork as part of a five-year project.

item.title: Data Subjects: Calibrating and Sieving
item.description: Who are the subjects of data practices? How do data practices configure the capacities of subjects to become part of a population?

item.title: Statistician Subjects: Differentiating and Defending
item.description: We consider how the statistician subject is being shaped, and the profession of national statistician repositioned, through professionalising practices.

item.title: Upon Not Opening The Black Box
item.description: We offer a discussion on the value of data, its use and non-use, as well as how to live with this ambivalence.

item.title: Methods as Forces of Subjectivation: Experiments in the Remaking of Official Statistics
item.description: We develop the concept of methods as forces of subjectivation in relation to experiments we have encountered in a study of official population statistics.

item.title: Peopling Europe through Data Practices: Introduction to the Special Issue
item.description: What does it mean to say, I am European? Where does Europe begin and end? Who can legitimately claim to be a part of a European people?

item.title: Doing a Transversal Method: Developing an Ethics of Care in a Collaborative Research Project
item.description: We depart from some conceptual presuppositions of methodological cosmopolitanism to define a transversal method.

item.title: Beyond Mystery: Putting Algorithmic Accountability in Context
item.description: We cannot stop at denouncing the lack of accountability for algorithms but must engage the broader systems and that algorithmic systems exist within.

item.title: Citizen Data and Trust in Official Statistics
item.description: In a time of alternative facts, what constitutes legitimate knowledge and expertise are major political sites of contention and struggle.

item.title: Data Scientists: A New Faction of the Transnational Field of Statistics
item.description: We discuss how data science as a field and a profession came into being in relation to but also as a critique of existing ones such as statistics and statisticians.

item.title: CASE: A Framework for Computer Supported Outbreak Detection
item.description:
Background

In computer supported outbreak detection, a statistical method is applied to a collection of cases to detect any excess cases for a particular disease. Whether a detected aberration is a true outbreak is decided by a human expert. We present a technical framework designed and implemented at the Swedish Institute for Infectious Disease Control for computer supported outbreak detection, where a database of case reports for a large number of infectious diseases can be processed using one or more statistical methods selected by the user.
